trans-unit.source: Writes an array to a specified file

seg-source.mrk: Writes an array to a specified file

target.mrk: Writes an array to a specified file

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned by FileOpen().

seg-source.mrk: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned by FileOpen().

target.mrk: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned by FileOpen().

trans-unit.source: The array to be written to the specified file.

seg-source.mrk: The array to be written to the specified file.

target.mrk: The array to be written to the specified file.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Start array index to read, normally set to 0 or 1. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: Start array index to read, normally set to 0 or 1.

target.mrk: Start array index to read, normally set to 0 or 1.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Set to the last record you want to write to the File. Default is the whole array.

seg-source.mrk: Set to the last record you want to write to the File.

target.mrk: Set to the last record you want to write to the File.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Delimiter character(s) for 2-dimension arrays. Default is "|".
Return Value
0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: @error:
1 - Error opening specified file
2 - $aArray is not an array
3 - Error writing to file
4 - $aArray is not a 1D or 2D array
5 - Start index is greater than the $iUbound parameter

seg-source.mrk: 5 - Start index is greater than the $iUbound parameter

target.mrk: 5 - Start index is greater than the $iUbound parameter

trans-unit.source: Remarks
If a string path is provided, the file will be overwritten and closed.

seg-source.mrk: If a string path is provided, the file will be overwritten and closed.

target.mrk: If a string path is provided, the file will be overwritten and closed.

trans-unit.source: To use other write modes, like append or Unicode formats, open the file with FileOpen() first and pass the file handle instead.

seg-source.mrk: To use other write modes, like append or Unicode formats, open the file with FileOpen() first and pass the file handle instead.

target.mrk: To use other write modes, like append or Unicode formats, open the file with FileOpen() first and pass the file handle instead.

trans-unit.source: If a file handle is passed, the file will still be open after writing.

seg-source.mrk: If a file handle is passed, the file will still be open after writing.

target.mrk: If a file handle is passed, the file will still be open after writing.

target.mrk: List all the files in the current script directory.

seg-source.mrk: Create a file in the users %TEMP% directory.

target.mrk: Create a file in the users %TEMP% directory.
